html:
Eilish sang a stripped-down version of the Hit Me Hard and Soft ballad, accompanied by her brother Finneas on acoustic guitar

Billie Eilish was one of the performers at the 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards, which took place this evening, March 17, at Los Angeles’ Dolby Theatre. Eilish opened the ceremony with a stripped-down version of “Wildflower” from her 2024 album Hit Me Hard and Soft, accompanied by her brother Finneas on acoustic guitar. Watch it below.

The 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards were hosted by LL Cool J; Bad Bunny, Glorilla, Gracie Abrams, and more were also announced as performers. Later tonight, Lady Gaga will receive the Innovator Award—which went to Beyoncé last year—while Mariah Carey will be presented with the Icon Award.

Last month, Eilish performed her hit single “Birds of a Feather” at the 2025 Grammy Awards. The pop star was nominated in seven categories, including Album of the Year, Song of the Year, and Record of the Year, but did not take home any trophies.

Read more about Eilish in Clover Hope’s column “Why Do the Real Songs on Love Is Blind Sound So Wrong?”
